title: The Best Healthy Snacks To Keep You Going
summary: KIND bars are made with whole grains, nuts, fruits, and spices. Dark cocoa is great for boosting mood and energy, and nuts and sea salt have nutrients that help to boost energy. Bananas are also great for the brain and help to improve focus, making them a great snack to keep you going throughout the day. Beans and legumes are one of the best sources of fiber that you can eat, and they’re also high in protein. Greek yogurt is a great option for snacking on the go, and it’s also good for the bones.

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Think about your typical work day. You probably spend the first few hours of it at your desk, sipping on a cup of coffee, reading emails, and maybe even taking a brief walk around the office to stretch your legs. Then you head back to your desk, only to dive into an afternoon filled with more reading and typing\u2014no time for walking again. And by 5pm you\u2019re ready to call it a day and head home. However, in that short span of time, you need to find some way to keep going through all those tasks. What do you do?
The answer is simple: Healthy snacks! Think about how much time you spend away from home throughout the day \u2013 whether it\u2019s at work or school, there are plenty of opportunities for snacking. In fact, keeping healthy snacks around can help boost your energy when you need it most. Check out these top-rated healthy snacks that will keep you going all day long\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get Moving When You Don't Have Time for the Gym

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`New Year, same old resolutions. If you\u2019re anything like the majority of people, chances are that you have made the same resolution to get fitter, healthier and happier this year as you did last year. But with a packed work schedule, social calendar and everything else going on in your life it can be difficult to find time to hit the gym or take up that new Zumba class you signed up for last October but never went to again.
And yet so many of us do manage to get moving. Yes, it might involve setting your alarm an hour earlier than usual, waking up on Saturday morning instead of Friday night and putting in some serious dedication \u2014 but it is possible. So if you\u2019re struggling to find time for the gym here are some creative ways how you can get moving when you don\u2019t have time for the gym:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Exercising Your Way to a Fitter You: Walk or Run - Which Is Best for You?

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"In today\u2019s fast-paced world, we have less time to work out and still keep up with all our responsibilities. But with the right plan, anyone can make time for exercise. The question is: What type of exercise should you focus on to get the best results in the shortest amount of time? Walking or running may seem like two very different exercises, but when it comes to burning fat and calories, your body responds in similar ways no matter which one you choose. In this article, we\u2019ll discuss the benefits of each one and which is best for you based on your personal fitness level. Keep reading to discover more!"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 3 Easy Exercises You Can Do in Your Home That Will Make You Lose Weight

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you get home from work, the last thing you want to do is another workout. But working out is essential for losing weight and keeping it off. Exercise not only helps you lose weight faster and keep it off, but also improves your overall health and reduces the risk of developing chronic diseases. If you feel like hitting the gym after work isn\u2019t an option, take a look at these easy ways you can get moving in the comfort of your own home.
Working out at home has many benefits; it\u2019s convenient, cheap, private, and most importantly\u2014you can do it whenever you want! It\u2019s also a great way to strengthen your body without needing to leave the house or spend a lot of money on expensive gym memberships or personal trainers. Working out in your home not only saves you time but is also a convenient way to keep yourself motivated to stay active every day.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 8 Ways to Make Healthy Eating More Exciting

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In today\u2019s world, it\u2019s not easy to stick to healthy eating habits. Everywhere you look there are temptations that make it difficult to eat the right things. However, with the right approach and mindset, healthy eating doesn\u2019t have to be boring or restrictive. You just need a bit of inspiration and ideas on how to make healthy eating exciting again. Eating well doesn\u2019t need to be dull or uninteresting \u2013 in fact, it can be quite the opposite if you bring your A-game to the table.
If you\u2019re struggling with making healthy eating more exciting, here are some ways that can help get you back on track so you can enjoy great food while still feeling good about what you\u2019re putting in your body.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Eat Healthy on the Go

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Going on a road trip, catching an early morning flight or going to your new internship for the first time can all be stressful. You have to leave home at ungodly hours to get there on time, you have to read through pages of instructions and you might even have to fend for yourself without your parents\u2019 help. This is where packing healthy snacks comes in handy.
On-the-go food isn\u2019t always healthy and nutritious. With more fast food chains popping up everywhere, it\u2019s becoming increasingly difficult for us to find healthy meals that are also quick and convenient to eat. If you find yourself caught off guard by these circumstances often, here are some tips on how you can eat healthy while traveling or commuting.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Exercises You Can Do at Home and save a Ton of Money

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Who says working out has to be expensive? You can do it anywhere and anytime. There are various affordable home workout videos available on the internet as well. However, that doesn\u2019t mean you have to break the bank when trying to save money in other areas of your life. Those at-home videos might seem like your only cheap option, but there are plenty of ways you can cut down on costs while still getting the same benefits from working out at home.
Instead of splurging on a one-time membership or an expensive series of DVDs, why not invest in some home equipment that won\u2019t cost you a fortune, but will help you get in great shape? Working out at home also has its advantages: no traffic jams and no gym membership fees! Here are 10 cheap home workout ideas for anyone who wants to slim down and tone up without breaking their budget.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of Regular Exercise - And How to Get Started

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Getting into a regular workout routine is something that\u2019s a lot easier said than done for most people. While some of us have it easier than others when it comes to fitting fitness into our busy lives, we all struggle with different things at one point or another. It\u2019s easy to let other responsibilities fall by the wayside and not get moving, so you need to be strategic about how and when you work out. While there are many different benefits to exercise, the biggest thing that it has to offer is stress reduction. If you\u2019re looking for ways to reduce your stress in your everyday life, adding exercise to your routine is a great place to start. Here are some reasons why getting your sweat on regularly could be exactly what you need right now:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Eat Healthy on a Busy Schedule

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Eating healthy on a busy schedule is no easy task. It\u2019s not like we all have hours to cook and prep the perfect meal after a long day at school or work. So how are we supposed to eat right when there\u2019s barely time to even pick up fast food? Well, the answer isn\u2019t as hard as you might think\u2026 If you are ready to take control of your diet, then read on\u2026
If you feel like your life is always in hyper-speed and there\u2019s never enough hours in the day to get everything done, then you know exactly how these pressures can lead to unhealthy eating habits. But that doesn\u2019t have to be the case forever. Even with a busy schedule, it is totally possible for anyone to eat healthy meals regularly.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
